ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] not parsing Flash links
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Andrea, What you are seeing is not related to the relative URL bug. It is just that our current swf extractor is not finding the links triggered by button

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] not parsing Flash links
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137477665; y=fMuO_HlFrBU87zF8fGlKU9ZJw7h_5e-b0XS5gVsIqQAnW3h2jg

Hi Andrea,

What you are seeing is not related to the 'relative URL' bug. It is just 
that our current swf extractor is not finding the links triggered by 
button mouse events like mouseOver, Out, Release and etc. I looked at 
the extractor and it would be easy to add code that would parse those 
links by trying all strings/constants that look like URIs (in similar 
fashion as our JavaScript extractor).

I will make an issue and run some tests.

Take care,
i.



> Hi,
> 
> During a crawl of one seed (http://www.fas.harvard.edu/~bioanth/) it
> only picks up the first page because all the links off that page are
> from within Flash files and it looks like its not finding the links in
> the files. Here's one of the Flash files:
> http://www.fas.harvard.edu/~bioanth/new_swf/navigation_bio.swf
> 
> I'm using heritrix 1.12.1 and have the ExtractorSWF enabled. I think
> that the Flash relative links bug reported at
> http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER-577 was already fixed in
> this version. Is there an easy way to test ExtractorSWF against the
> URI? I didn't see a test class to use for that extractor.
> 
> thanks,
> Andrea
> 
> Here's the crawl log for that harvest (there's no entries in
> local-errors or runtime-errors):
